answers.answer: It's always nice to buy things to help get you started for your baby.. I started at 25 weeks.. Then right after my baby shower I bought the rest of the things I needed..

I have about the same amount of time from my due date and we have her nursery set up and all her big items are purchased. We also have a nice supply of diapers , wipes, formula and clothes. We started buying items around 12 weeks. Even though I'm due in Jan she will be here in 7-8 weeks if not sooner due to me developing preeclampsia and gestational diabeties. You never know what could happen or when your baby will decide to arrive so it's always better to be prepared!
Never too early..better over prepared then under. But that's just me. All I need are all her diapers and wipes, bottles and bath tub. Other than that we're good to go.  Best wishes :)

I started buying as soon as we found out what we were having both times. I did buy a couple of unisex onesies when I first found out I was pregnant just because I was super excited. After I had the baby shower, if we needed anything else, then I bought it.
I have 89 days and we're waiting a few more weeks until after the baby shower. We have a few newborn sleepers because they were too cute to pass up but that's it. I can't wait tho.

I'm 24 weeks and I have been purchasing stuff here and there as we come across the deals. I suggest you get some of the bigger stuff sooner than later though. Some items have to be ordered and cantake a couple of weeks. And you never know if the little one will surprise you with an early arrival. Besides those big items, I would say just make sure you have the essentials once you hit the 30's.
Im at 31 wks and I have bought everything but crib mattress sheets, bottles and other odds and ends. Always better to be prepared.

I have 79 days left. Just after you :) I have bought one outfit, a blanket and that's pretty much it. I'm waiting til after the shower. I want to save as much money as I can. I say do what makes you happy. Some people think buying things makes them feel more connected with the baby. That's not really me. I'm starting to focus more on the nursery: paint, decorations, furniture. That's my husband's and mine responsibility so that's where we will focus our money and energy.

question: left & still havent shopped for my little guy i think its too early what do you guys think???
title: 77 days!!!!
